perturbation.original_text: Fox grants to Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the Property "ICE AGE: THE MELTDOWN" in the United States: (A) 2 Scrat voicetones; (B) 2 John Leguizamo voicetones; and (C) 3 premium videos. Fox also grants Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the Property "ICE AGE 2" outside of the United States: (A) 4 Scrat voicetones; (B) 1 John Leguizamo voicetone; and (C) 3 premium videos. (collectively, "IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products")
perturbation.changed_text: Fox grants to Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the Property "ICE AGE: THE MELTDOWN" in the United States: (A) 2 Scrat voicetones; (B) 2 John Leguizamo voicetones; and (C) 3 premium videos. Fox also grants Recipient a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the Property "ICE AGE 2" outside of the United States: (A) 4 Scrat voicetones; (B) 1 John Leguizamo voicetone; and (C) 3 premium videos. (collectively, "IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products")
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensee' to 'Recipient' in the second sentence introduces ambiguity. It's unclear if 'Licensee' and 'Recipient' refer to the same entity, thus casting doubt on whether the distribution rights outside the US are granted to the same party as those within the US. This creates uncertainty regarding contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Royalty: In consideration of the rights granted to Licensee pursuant to this Amendment 2, Licensee shall pay to Fox, or such other party as Fox may designate in writing, a royalty in the following amount:

(a) From the first unit sold, Fox shall earn a royalty at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee's Gross Receipts (as defined in the Agreement) from Licensee's sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products. ("IA2 Audio and Video Royalty"). For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee may not recoup any portion of the Ice Age 2 Guarantee (as defined in Amendment 1) through its sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.
perturbation.changed_text:
Royalty: In consideration of the rights granted to Distributor pursuant to this Amendment 2, Licensee shall pay to Fox, or such other party as Fox may designate in writing, a royalty in the following amount:

(a) From the first unit sold, Fox shall earn a royalty at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee's Gross Receipts (as defined in the Agreement) from Licensee's sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products. ("IA2 Audio and Video Royalty"). For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee may not recoup any portion of the Ice Age 2 Guarantee (as defined in Amendment 1) through its sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensee' to 'Distributor' in the first sentence, while keeping 'Licensee' later in the section, introduces a contradiction. It becomes unclear whether 'Distributor' and 'Licensee' are the same entity. If they are different, it's uncertain which entity is responsible for paying the royalty, and who can recoup the guarantee, as both are still referring to Licensee.

perturbation.original_text: Except as herein expressly amended or by necessary implication modified by this Amendment, the Agreement in all other respects is hereby ratified and shall continue in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as herein expressly amended or by necessary implication modified by this Addendum, the Agreement in all other respects is hereby ratified and shall continue in full force and effect.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Amendment' to 'Addendum' creates confusion regarding the legal status of the document. While both can modify an agreement, they might imply different levels of integration or legal weight. This can lead to disputes about which terms are actually binding, especially given the preceding introduction of conflicting terms.
